biotools.summary:
Mammal ncRNA-disease repository with increased coverage and annotation.

Mammalian ncRNA-Disease Repository.

MNDR v3.1: Mammal NcRNA-Disease Repository.

MNDR (Mammalian ncRNA-Disease Repository) is a database that curated associations between ncRNA and disease. Here, we have updated the MNDR to version 3.1 by integrating experimentally supported and predicted ncRNA-disease associations curated from manual literatures and other resources. MNDR v3.1 currently contains more than one million ncRNA-disease entries, including 6,301 miRNAs, 39,880 lncRNAs, 20,256 circRNAs, 10,894 piRNAs and 521 snoRNAs with over 1,600 diseases, and an increase of species coverage to 11 mammals.

MNDR v3.1 currently contains more than one million ncRNA-disease entries, including 6,301 miRNAs, 39,880 lncRNAs, 20,256 circRNAs, 10,894 piRNAs and 521 snoRNAs with over 1,600 diseases, and an increase of species coverage to 11 mammals.
